metadata.document_title: GZM AI Strategy 2030 - Key Performance Indicators
metadata.strategy_name: GZM AI-Ready (si4śl - Sztuczna Inteligencja dla Śląskiego)

strategic_context.government_recognition: Ministry of Digital Affairs recognized GZM as leading AI center (Nov 17, 2025)
strategic_context.role: Integrator - providing infrastructure, competencies, and market access
strategic_context.vision: Transform post-industrial region into data-driven economy hub

strategic_pillars.name: Infrastructure and Data (Foundation)
strategic_pillars.description: Building computational capacity, data governance, and digital infrastructure

strategic_pillars.name: Competencies and Human Capital (People)
strategic_pillars.description: Upskilling public servants, educating citizens, building AI-ready workforce

strategic_pillars.name: Implementation Mechanisms and Governance (Market)
strategic_pillars.description: Creating market demand, governance structures, and pilot programs

primary_kpis.description: Core measurable indicators for strategy evaluation by 2030

metrics.indicator: Active AI deployments in GZM municipalities
metrics.notes: Primary success indicator - demonstrates real-world AI adoption across region

metrics.indicator: Municipalities covered by 'Data Steward' support program
metrics.notes: Each municipality must have designated Data Steward for data quality and governance

metrics.indicator: Public servants trained in 'Civil Servant 2.0' program
metrics.notes: Focus on identifying 'Change Leaders' within existing staff rather than mass hiring

metrics.indicator: Average time from idea to pilot launch
metrics.notes: Measures organizational agility and ability to test innovations quickly
Building digitally aware society and future workforce; includes libraries and cultural centers as digital hubs

metrics.description: Dedicated AI computational resources for GZM ecosystem (municipalities and partners)
metrics.notes: Access to computational time for all ecosystem participants without delays

quick_wins_pilots.description: Immediate pilot projects ('Lighthouses') to build trust in strategy - 2026

projects.name: ZTM Voice Assistant (Voicebot)
projects.description: Automated info-line for public transport schedules and fares
projects.responsible: ZTM GZM Operational AI Support Department

projects.name: Intelligent Complaint Analysis (Feedback Loop AI)
projects.description: LLM-based system for categorizing citizen complaints and trend detection
projects.use_case: Automatic detection of infrastructure issues (e.g., potholes)

projects.name: Metropolitan Digital Twin (Social)
projects.description: Simulation model prototype for crisis management using local computational resources
projects.success_metric: Functional simulation for at least 3 crisis scenarios

projects.name: GZM Campus Data Integration (Project 10.26)
projects.description: Automated data collection from universities (scraping/API) as technical PoC
projects.purpose: Test data integration processes in distributed environment
projects.success_metric: Automated integration with 80% of participating universities
projects.replication_potential: Model can be replicated for municipalities, cultural centers

early_warning_system.description: Critical signals requiring immediate corrective action if detected in 2026 (first year)

red_flags.critical_signal: Business waiting time for CETINO resources > 72 hours
red_flags.corrective_procedure: Audit access procedures and increase support team (One-Stop-Shop model)

red_flags.critical_signal: Less than 20% municipalities systemically integrated by Q4 2026
red_flags.corrective_procedure: Launch central technical team implementing standards in municipalities ('Flying Squad')

red_flags.critical_signal: Social acceptance for automation drops below 50%
red_flags.corrective_procedure: Mandatory UX audit of systems and educational campaign for seniors

red_flags.critical_signal: Municipalities withdrawing from projects after local government changes
red_flags.corrective_procedure: Implement 'Metropolitan Pact' - multi-year agreements beyond electoral terms

risk_mitigation.description: Key risks identified and mitigation strategies

risks.name: Artificial Ecosystem (supply without demand)
risks.description: Creating grant-driven solutions that fail after funding ends

mitigation_strategy.approach: Implementation voucher mechanism requires real recipient (municipality)

risks.name: Technical Debt and Uncertainty
risks.description: Large hardware investments becoming obsolete before implementation

mitigation_strategy.requirement: Open-source solutions instead of vendor lock-in

risks.name: Social and Worker Resistance
risks.description: Fear of automation and job loss

risks.name: Centralization vs. Autonomy
risks.description: Municipality concerns about losing independence to 'central authority'

mitigation_strategy.architecture: Federated systems - municipalities retain data ownership
mitigation_strategy.role_gzm: GZM provides only standards and tools

mechanisms.name: Fast Track Procedure
mechanisms.description: Quick approval process for innovative projects

mechanisms.name: Progressive Conditionality Principle
mechanisms.description: Gradual requirements for metropolitan funding access

stages.requirement: Digital transformation plan compliant with GZM standards + API availability
20% of funding allocation dependent on real integration with GZM Data Store
Full interoperability as prerequisite for 'soft' project funding

mechanisms.safety_mechanism: If <20% municipalities integrated by 2026, launch Flying Squad intervention team

implementation_voucher_system.description: Mechanism to stimulate internal market and break 'first implementation' deadlock

components.name: Implementation Vouchers
components.purpose: Municipality purchases solutions from local companies

quality_safeguards.mechanism: Final tranche paid after end-user adoption confirmation

quality_safeguards.requirement: Mandatory open code or API for supplier switching

components.name: Safe Sandbox
components.role_gzm: Assumes legal and financial risk for early testing

components.name: Technology Bridge
components.purpose: Finance local startup pilots with large investors

data_assets.description: Key data resources driving AI development

assets.name: ZTM Transport Data

components.data_type: Precise passenger flow data from counting gates
components.note: Real-time vehicle occupancy NOT shared via Open Data due to security concerns (terrorist threat)

assets.value: Enables training predictive models for public transport at unprecedented scale in Poland

funding_sources.description: Main funding mechanisms for strategy implementation

success_pathway.description: Transition from Research to Scaling phase
enabling_factors: Government recognition as leading AI center (2027)
Access to supercomputers and central funding
Strong academic base (Silesian University of Technology, Łukasiewicz-AI Institute)

q3: Complete municipality digital transformation plan assessment

2027.key_event: Official status as leading AI center becomes effective (Jan 1)
